chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)
Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tou Kong Lor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.

AODA.

DNA sample.

1 day credit if revoked.
Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.

No possession of and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and taken as prescribed.

No contact with K.M.L. unless approved by Dept of SS in Portage CO.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): K.M.L. Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
